intro: Coussarea sancti-ciprianii, commonly known as the Saint Ciprian's coussarea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the island's tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat and rarity, it is considered an endangered species.
